meanings.definition: To remove water or moisture from (a substance)
meanings.sent1: After leaving the apple slices in the sun, they will dehydrate and become dry.
meanings.sent2: Plants dehydrate when they do not receive enough water.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally left my water bottle open, and now it looks like it's trying to dehydrate itself!
meanings.sent4: The desert sun seemed to dehydrate the land, turning it into a barren wasteland.
meanings.sent5: The sponge's job is to dehydrate the spilled water, leaving the surface dry.

meanings.sent1: If you exercise a lot, you may dehydrate and need to drink more water.
meanings.sent2: Fruits and vegetables can dehydrate if not stored properly.
meanings.sent3: The raincoat was so good at keeping water out that it started to dehydrate itself!
meanings.sent4: The intense heat caused the river to dehydrate, leaving behind cracked mud.
meanings.sent5: The hot summer sun can quickly dehydrate your body, so remember to drink plenty of water.
